15#ifndef DNS_VALIDATOR_H
16#define DNS_VALIDATOR_H 1
17
18/*****
19 ***** Module Info
20 *****/
21
22/*! \file dns/validator.h
23 *
24 * \brief
25 * DNS Validator
26 * This is the BIND 9 validator, the module responsible for validating the
27 * rdatasets and negative responses (messages). It makes use of zones in
28 * the view and may fetch RRset to complete trust chains. It implements
29 * DNSSEC as specified in RFC 4033, 4034 and 4035.
30 *
31 * It can also optionally implement ISC's DNSSEC look-aside validation.
32 *
33 * Correct operation is critical to preventing spoofed answers from secure
34 * zones being accepted.
35 *
36 * MP:
37 *\li The module ensures appropriate synchronization of data structures it
38 * creates and manipulates.
39 *
40 * Reliability:
41 *\li No anticipated impact.
42 *
43 * Resources:
44 *\li TBS
45 *
46 * Security:
47 *\li No anticipated impact.
48 *
49 * Standards:
50 *\li RFCs: 1034, 1035, 2181, 4033, 4034, 4035.
51 */
52
53#include <stdbool.h>
54
55#include <isc/lang.h>
56#include <isc/event.h>
57#include <isc/mutex.h>
58
59#include <dns/fixedname.h>
60#include <dns/types.h>
61#include <dns/rdataset.h>
62#include <dns/rdatastruct.h> /* for dns_rdata_rrsig_t */
63
64#include <dst/dst.h>
65
66/*%
67 * A dns_validatorevent_t is sent when a 'validation' completes.
68 * \brief
69 * 'name', 'rdataset', 'sigrdataset', and 'message' are the values that were
70 * supplied when dns_validator_create() was called. They are returned to the
71 * caller so that they may be freed.
72 *
73 * If the RESULT is ISC_R_SUCCESS and the answer is secure then
74 * proofs[] will contain the names of the NSEC records that hold the
75 * various proofs. Note the same name may appear multiple times.
76 */
77typedef struct dns_validatorevent {
78 ISC_EVENT_COMMON(struct dns_validatorevent);
79 dns_validator_t * validator;
80 isc_result_t result;
81 /*
82 * Name and type of the response to be validated.
83 */
84 dns_name_t * name;
85 dns_rdatatype_t type;
86 /*
87 * Rdata and RRSIG (if any) for positive responses.
88 */
89 dns_rdataset_t * rdataset;
90 dns_rdataset_t * sigrdataset;
91 /*
92 * The full response. Required for negative responses.
93 * Also required for positive wildcard responses.
94 */
95 dns_message_t * message;
96 /*
97 * Proofs to be cached.
98 */
99 dns_name_t * proofs[4];
100 /*
101 * Optout proof seen.
102 */
103 bool optout;
104 /*
105 * Answer is secure.
106 */
107 bool secure;
108} dns_validatorevent_t;
109
110#define DNS_VALIDATOR_NOQNAMEPROOF 0
111#define DNS_VALIDATOR_NODATAPROOF 1
112#define DNS_VALIDATOR_NOWILDCARDPROOF 2
113#define DNS_VALIDATOR_CLOSESTENCLOSER 3
114
115/*%
116 * A validator object represents a validation in progress.
117 * \brief
118 * Clients are strongly discouraged from using this type directly, with
119 * the exception of the 'link' field, which may be used directly for
120 * whatever purpose the client desires.
121 */
122struct dns_validator {
123 /* Unlocked. */
124 unsigned int magic;
125 isc_mutex_t lock;
126 dns_view_t * view;
127 /* Locked by lock. */
128 unsigned int options;
129 unsigned int attributes;
130 dns_validatorevent_t * event;
131 dns_fetch_t * fetch;
132 dns_validator_t * subvalidator;
133 dns_validator_t * parent;
134 dns_keytable_t * keytable;
135 dns_keynode_t * keynode;
136 dst_key_t * key;
137 dns_rdata_rrsig_t * siginfo;
138 isc_task_t * task;
139 isc_taskaction_t action;
140 void * arg;
141 unsigned int labels;
142 dns_rdataset_t * currentset;
143 bool seensig;
144 dns_rdataset_t * keyset;
145 dns_rdataset_t * dsset;
146 dns_rdataset_t * soaset;
147 dns_rdataset_t * nsecset;
148 dns_rdataset_t * nsec3set;
149 dns_name_t * soaname;
150 dns_rdataset_t frdataset;
151 dns_rdataset_t fsigrdataset;
152 dns_fixedname_t fname;
153 dns_fixedname_t wild;
154 dns_fixedname_t nearest;
155 dns_fixedname_t closest;
156 ISC_LINK(dns_validator_t) link;
157 dns_rdataset_t dlv;
158 dns_fixedname_t dlvsep;
159 bool havedlvsep;
160 bool mustbesecure;
161 unsigned int dlvlabels;
162 unsigned int depth;
163 unsigned int authcount;
164 unsigned int authfail;
165 isc_stdtime_t start;
166};
167
168/*%
169 * dns_validator_create() options.
170 */
171#define DNS_VALIDATOR_DLV 0x0001U
172#define DNS_VALIDATOR_DEFER 0x0002U
173#define DNS_VALIDATOR_NOCDFLAG 0x0004U
174#define DNS_VALIDATOR_NONTA 0x0008U /*% Ignore NTA table */
175
176ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
177
178isc_result_t
179dns_validator_create(dns_view_t *view, dns_name_t *name, dns_rdatatype_t type,
180 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset, dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset,
181 dns_message_t *message, unsigned int options,
182 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg,
183 dns_validator_t **validatorp);
184/*%<
185 * Start a DNSSEC validation.
186 *
187 * This validates a response to the question given by
188 * 'name' and 'type'.
189 *
190 * To validate a positive response, the response data is
191 * given by 'rdataset' and 'sigrdataset'. If 'sigrdataset'
192 * is NULL, the data is presumed insecure and an attempt
193 * is made to prove its insecurity by finding the appropriate
194 * null key.
195 *
196 * The complete response message may be given in 'message',
197 * to make available any authority section NSECs that may be
198 * needed for validation of a response resulting from a
199 * wildcard expansion (though no such wildcard validation
200 * is implemented yet). If the complete response message
201 * is not available, 'message' is NULL.
202 *
203 * To validate a negative response, the complete negative response
204 * message is given in 'message'. The 'rdataset', and
205 * 'sigrdataset' arguments must be NULL, but the 'name' and 'type'
206 * arguments must be provided.
207 *
208 * The validation is performed in the context of 'view'.
209 *
210 * When the validation finishes, a dns_validatorevent_t with
211 * the given 'action' and 'arg' are sent to 'task'.
212 * Its 'result' field will be ISC_R_SUCCESS iff the
213 * response was successfully proven to be either secure or
214 * part of a known insecure domain.
215 *
216 * options:
217 * If DNS_VALIDATOR_DLV is set the caller knows there is not a
218 * trusted key and the validator should immediately attempt to validate
219 * the answer by looking for an appropriate DLV RRset.
220 */
221
222void
223dns_validator_send(dns_validator_t *validator);
224/*%<
225 * Send a deferred validation request
226 *
227 * Requires:
228 * 'validator' to points to a valid DNSSEC validator.
229 */
230
231void
232dns_validator_cancel(dns_validator_t *validator);
233/*%<
234 * Cancel a DNSSEC validation in progress.
235 *
236 * Requires:
237 *\li 'validator' points to a valid DNSSEC validator, which
238 * may or may not already have completed.
239 *
240 * Ensures:
241 *\li It the validator has not already sent its completion
242 * event, it will send it with result code ISC_R_CANCELED.
243 */
244
245void
246dns_validator_destroy(dns_validator_t **validatorp);
247/*%<
248 * Destroy a DNSSEC validator.
249 *
250 * Requires:
251 *\li '*validatorp' points to a valid DNSSEC validator.
252 * \li The validator must have completed and sent its completion
253 * event.
254 *
255 * Ensures:
256 *\li All resources used by the validator are freed.
257 */
258
259ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
260
261#endif /* DNS_VALIDATOR_H */
262
